p.s: Sonnet 116, written by William Shakespeare is addressed to a young man with whom the poet has a deep and loving friendship.
This sonnet deals with the alteration of love and the doom of the love to the young man.
The poet says that the love always changechanges and that love is not love.
The doom also help by love.
He realised that if he did not have written, he never loved the man.
Love alters in every way, but not in brief hours and weeks.
